ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: i felt that some of the speakers were irrelevant or not advanced in their lectures, but maybe that's because i had a background in some of the areas

I truly enjoyed this class and felt there was just the right amount of work, field trips, and lectures. I felt that the course was very balanced in that we talked about a wide range of subjects and made excellent use of time in each class. It is very apparent that Mr. Yost and his TA spent a lot of time planning the course curriculum to be as integrated as possible.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Field trips
The background of the Professor creates plenty of opportunities to discussion about the topic.
i liked some of the online quizzes, but some of them were difficult (answers not found in the text) and some of them had overt grammatical typos.
The field trips were very useful and I learnt a lot from it

I enjoyed the guest speakers, who all provided unique perspectives on green buildings. I also felt that the field trips packed a lot of information into a small period of time, especially the trip to the School of Management. Finally, I enjoyed the assignments where we looked at mechanical systems, glazing, and IEQ for nearby buildings.
The course provides an overview of what green buildings are and how complex the building systems are. It is rather general but for people without background knowledge, it is a good course.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Examples of tropical context
I don't know when, but one extra field-trip would be nice.
the random hw assignments needed more clarification and discussion, as did the final project. the goal was far too broad and didn't have a question or goal.
I wish the class was held in a different classroom. The basement of Kroon is very dreary.
The constant addition of HW and assignments, along with the lack of adequate class materials on some topics presented a challenge.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am doing a research thesis on Bus Rapid Transit construction and one of the aspects I will be looking at is the materials that will be used to create the stations. I took this class to learn more about green building materials and how architects and builders minimize their carbon footprint.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to expand my knowledge on green building

I took this course to learn more about buildings, as I did not have much experience with them beforehand. I was shopping several different courses at the beginning of the semester and Mr. Yost seemed like an engaging lecturer.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, it did.
i learned less than i thought i would unfortunately.
Yes the class met my expectations

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We had group discussions and did a couple of group assignments like the glazing assignment. I thought that these were helpful in getting to know our classmates and offered an opportunity to exchange ideas. I chose not to work in a group for my final project mainly due to personal preference.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It is a nice class. The final project is time consuming, try to talk and adjust its outline as soon as possible with Peter and the TA.
it's most beneficial for someone who does not have a green building background although some of the material was quite advanced
I would recommend the class if you are interested on green buildings
I would recommend choosing a final project that is very interesting to you and relevant to your background.
